alert.note: Alert for Northern Piscataquis; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 4:29PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow showers will affect east central Piscataquis...southeastern Aroostook and north central Penobscot Counties... At 426 PM EST...An area of heavy snow showers was along a line extending from near Amity to 10 miles south of Mount Katahdin...and moving southeast AT 10 MPH. A second line of heavy snow showers was along a line extending from near Dudley to Ripogenus...and moving southeast AT 10 MPH. Locations impacted include... Houlton, Patten, Mount Katahdin, Hodgdon, Sherman, Island Falls, Smyrna, Amity, Mount Chase, Haynesville, Sherman Station, Cary Plantation, Smyrna Mills, Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument, Baxter State Park, Linneus, Oakfield, New Limerick, Ludlow and Stacyville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 253 and 303. US Highway 1 between Orient and Houlton. State Highway 11 between Grindstone and Patten. * Winds in excess of 25 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow showers. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter mile in this area of heavy snow showers. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
